feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:41PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Late Tonight Through Monday Night... Snow is expected above 3000 feet from late tonight through Monday night. Several inches is possible above 3000 feet, with up to 4 inches above 4000 feet. Snow will taper off Monday night.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:39PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 4000 Feet through Monday... Snow is expected above 4000 feet from late tonight through Monday night. Up to 3 inches above 4000 feet. Snow will taper off Monday night.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:39PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water on the Tanana River and Tributaries Draining the Alaska Range Continues This Week... High water on the Tanana River and tributaries draining the Alaska Range will continue this week. This includes the Chisana River, Nabesna River, Gerstle River, Delta River, and the Nenana River. The Tanana River is running near bankfull with minor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Tanana River from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs * WHEN...Through noon Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The Tanana River is near or at bankfull from Old Minto

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 3:45PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Tanana River from Nenana to Old Minto * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The Tanana River is bankfull from Nenana to Old Minto with minor flooding occurring or expected in some low lying areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 1:16PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WATER EXPECTED TO CONTINUE IN THE SUSITNA BASIN... High water levels can be expected to continue on the Susitna River and its tributaries through the next couple of days. This includes the Talkeetna, Yentna, Skwentna, Kashwitna and Little Susitna Rivers and associated streams such as Willow, Montana and Moose Creeks.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 1:22PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CARROLL COUNTY THROUGH 200 PM CDT... At 121 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Green Forest, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 04 at 1:21PM CDT until September 04 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL SEARCY...EASTERN NEWTON...NORTHEASTERN JOHNSON AND NORTHWESTERN POPE COUNTIES... At 121 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Dillen, or 13 miles south of Jasper, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:14AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED WILDFIRE POTENTIAL FOR WESTERN UPPER MICHIGAN DUE TO A COMBINATION OF GUSTY SOUTH WINDS, DRY AND HOT CONDITIONS... Gusty south winds as high as 25 mph, combined with dry and hot conditions and a lack of recent rainfall will lead to elevated wildfire potential this afternoon across far western Upper Michigan.

The combination of low relative humidity values, near record to record temperatures, increased southwesterly/southerly winds, and drought conditions will result in elevated fire risk today across southeastern Minnesota and west-central into central Wisconsin. Afternoon relative humidity values will fall to around 25 to 30
entry.cap:areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Clark; Crawford; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Richland; Taylor; Trempealeau; Vernon

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 03 at 9:50PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY ISSUED FOR LAKE MICHIGAN SHORELINE WISCONSIN... The Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources has issued an Air Quality Advisory for Ozone from 9:00 AM CDT until 11:00 PM CDT on Monday, September 4, 2023. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 12:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Niobrara, northwestern Goshen, northeastern Platte and northeastern Converse Counties through 100 PM MDT... At 1214 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Dull Center to 9 miles northeast of Two Moon Campground. Movement was east at 45 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued September 04 at 2:20AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain Possible Today Across Northwestern and Northern Wyoming... A Pacific System continues to bring above normal moisture values to Wyoming today through Tuesday morning. Locations west of the Continental Divide, mainly over the higher terrain, could receive another quarter to one inch of rain Monday morning through Tuesday
